title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
summary: A comedic science fiction adventure following Arthur Dent after Earth is destroyed to make way for a hyperspace bypass.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
summary: A novel of manners about the Bennet sisters, focusing on Elizabeth and Mr. Darcy as they navigate love, class, and first impressions.

author: George Orwell
summary: A dystopian story where Winston Smith rebels against a totalitarian regime that surveils citizens and rewrites truth.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
summary: Through the eyes of Scout Finch, the novel explores racial injustice and moral growth in the American South.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: Bilbo Baggins joins a company of dwarves to reclaim their homeland from the dragon Smaug, discovering courage along the way.

title: The Name of the Wind
author: Patrick Rothfuss
summary: Kvothe recounts his life: his troupe, the University, music, magic, and his search for the mysterious Chandrian.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
summary: Astronaut Mark Watney is stranded on Mars and must use engineering, botany, and grit to survive until rescue.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
summary: On desert planet Arrakis, Paul Atreides confronts political intrigue, prophecy, and control of the spice melange.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
summary: Nick Carraway observes the tragic pursuit of the American Dream through the enigmatic millionaire Jay Gatsby.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
summary: Holden Caulfield, a disaffected teen, wanders New York City wrestling with grief, alienation, and identity.
